error-parsign.instructions: 1. Grab a dumbbell with your right hand, bend your knees, push your hips back and take the dumbbell between your feet.2. Pull the dumbbell up by extending your hips and knees and, as the dumbbell reaches your shoulder, rotate your hand to the front and punch straight up.3. Lower the dumbbell and return to the initial position.4. Repeat and then switch sides.
error-parsign.form: Keep your core engaged, relax your neck and back, and face forward. Keep the movement dynamic and continuous, and breathe out as you punch straight up and extend your body.
error-parsign.benefits: The single arm dumbbell snatch is a dynamic, compound move that works your whole body and improves your speed and agility. This exercise helps to develop your coordination and explosiveness and strengthens your shoulders, lower back, hamstrings, glutes, and lats.
error-parsign.related: Related Full Body Exercises Try these other full body exercises to get your heart rate up and burn even more calories:Knee to elbow kickbackBalance chopDumbbell skier swingCrab toe touches
error-parsign.sets: Start with 30-second sets or do 10 to 12 repetitions on each side. If youâ€™re a beginner practice doing thrusters, the lawnmower pull and the shoulder press first.
error-parsign.musclesAndEquipment: Primary muscles: ShouldersSecondary muscles: Lower back, calves, glutes, hamstrings, tricepsEquipment: Dumbbell / Kettlebell
